pullRequest.title: #1554 - Set error response to not-found on missing code or system
pullRequest.bodyText:
I updated the LookupOperation code so that a new type of FHIROperationException is thrown
with the code not-found when the code system lookup returns no result.
This will cause a 404 instead of a 400 error as detailed in the issue ticket and the referenced FHIR
document, but that is consistent with the behavior of the HAPI FHIR server, so it feels ok to me. 404
means NOT_FOUND vs. BAD_REQUEST which doesn't quite ring true.

commit.message:
I updated the code so that a new type of FHIROperationException is thrown
with the code not-found when the code system lookup returns no result.
This will cause a 404 instead of a 400 error, but that is consistent
with the behavior of the HAPI FHIR server, so it feels ok to me. 404
makes sense as NOT_FOUND.

Signed-off-by: Corey Sanders <sandersc@us.ibm.com>

with the behavior of the HAPI FHIR server, so it feels ok to me. 404
makes sense as NOT_FOUND.

commit.message:
Based on PR feedback switch to HTTP 400

Per recommendation from the core team, using the FHIR extension
mechanism to indicate to the framework that the HTTP status code should
change from the default behavior.

Signed-off-by: Corey Sanders <sandersc@us.ibm.com>
